title: MVP Sprint

forWhom.title: Who is this sprint for?
bullets: You want to validate an idea with a real prototype (not mockup) before investing in full development
You need a working demo to present to investors, clients or internal stakeholders
You want to test technical feasibility of complex architecture or features with a rapid PoC

items.name: Working Prototype
items.description: Deployed web-accessible application with core features working (not mockup)
items.format: Live web app with public or private URL

items.name: Clean Codebase
items.description: Git repository with clear, structured and commented code. Ready to be extended by your team

items.name: Automated Deploy
items.description: Basic CI/CD setup for deployment on Vercel/Railway/AWS. Push to deploy ready

items.name: Basic Metrics
items.description: Minimal analytics/monitoring to track usage and performance (Plausible, Sentry, or similar)

items.name: Technical Documentation
items.description: README with architecture, local setup, deploy, API docs (if applicable)

items.name: Handover Session
items.description: 1-2 hours code and architecture walkthrough with your team

requirements.title: What we need from you
items: Detailed brief (3-5 pages): objective, main user stories, constraints, audience
Design/wireframes (if you have UI already, otherwise I use Tailwind components/standard UI kit)
Access to third-party services/APIs if needed (test accounts OK)

process: Kickoff call: define scope, MVP features, tech stack and constraints
Each week: WIP build deployed for review and feedback
Rapid iterations: prioritize features based on feedback
Optional: post-launch support (1-2 weeks bugfix included)

faq.question: What is NOT included in an MVP Sprint?
faq.answer: Not full production-ready development. MVP is functional but may lack: advanced auth, edge cases, polished UI/UX, complete test coverage, enterprise scalability. It's designed to validate, not replace full-scale development.

faq.question: Can I extend the MVP after the sprint?
faq.answer: Yes. Codebase is clean and structured specifically to be extended. You can do it internally or we can continue with additional sprints.

faq.question: How 'working' is the prototype?
faq.answer: 100% functional for core features defined in scope. Not a clickable mockup: it's a deployed app you can use, test with real users and integrate with external services.

faq.question: Can I change scope during the sprint?
faq.answer: Yes, within reasonable limits. We work iteratively: if a feature becomes less priority after first test, we can change it. But significant scope creep extends timeline.

faq.question: Do I own the code?
faq.answer: Yes, 100%. Complete ownership of repo, code, deploy. After handover, you're the owner.
